intro: Vicia candolleana var. mesantlantica, commonly known as the Canary Islands vetch, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect, slender stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. This variety is notable for its ecological importance in supporting local insect populations.
